purpose: Seven powerful pirates sanctioned by the World Government to combat other pirates in exchange for legal immunity and other privileges.

keyMoments.title: Two Warlords at Thriller Bark
keyMoments.description: Episode 368 features two Warlords of the Sea: Gecko Moria, who commands Thriller Bark, and Bartholomew Kuma, who arrives on the island with mysterious intentions.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the complex relationships between Warlords and highlights that they don't always work together harmoniously.

keyMoments.title: Warlord's Fearsome Reputation
keyMoments.description: Perona recognizes Kuma as a Warlord of the Sea, equal in rank to her master Moria, and is immediately terrified of him despite her own considerable power.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes that even among the Warlords, there are vast differences in power and reputation.

purpose: The international governing body that rules over most of the world in One Piece, maintaining order through military might and political control.

keyMoments.title: World Government Interest in Luffy and Ace
keyMoments.description: Through Kuma, a World Government agent, questions are raised about Luffy's connection to his brother Ace, indicating government intelligence gathering on the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals that the World Government is tracking not just Luffy himself, but his family connections and relationships.
